Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Engorge \En*gorge"\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Engorged}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Engorging}.] [Pref. en- + gorge: cf. F. engorger to obstruct, cram.] 1. To gorge; to glut. --Mir. for Mag. [1913 Webster]
2. To swallow with greediness or in large quantities; to devour. --Spenser. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Engorged \En*gorged"\, p. a. 1. Swallowed with greediness, or in large draughts. [1913 Webster]
2. (Med.) Filled to excess with blood or other liquid; congested. [1913 Webster]
engorged adj : overfull as with blood [syn: {congested}]
